snippet: The expanded kidnapping wave occurred as the war in Syria staggered on, with battles in Aleppo and dozens of bodies found in a landfill outside Damascus.
abstract: Sectarian tensions escalate across Lebanon as Sunnis in border towns threaten Shiites after several Shiite families who had already abducted more than 30 Syrians add a few more to their hostage total; expanded kidnapping wave occurs as the war in Syria staggers on, suggesting that the threat of regional chaos from the conflict is increasing.

byline.contributor: Dalal Mawad contributed reporting from Beirut; Hwaida Saad from Antakya, Turkey; and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

lead_paragraph: The expanded kidnapping wave occurred as the war in Syria staggered on, with battles in Aleppo and dozens of bodies found in a landfill outside Damascus.
